comment: Even though this is an online class the workload was too much and he doesn't even check his emails

Assignments are a bit much, SUPER long, and major grade tests are on lockdown and video recorded. Teacher doesn't really respond to emails. Assignments are due every other week. It's kind of a 50/50 class you just have to get in the habit of it and hope to do well after every assignment.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: If you are reading this then do not take his class online! If you attempt to communicate with him after the first week, he will not respond. This professor has been absent for weeks. You will be taking this class by yourself with no instruction and the quizzes are incredibly hard. LOCKDOWN BROWSERS ON ALL QUIZZES.

Lectures are straight from the book so I just tuned him out and took notes from the book. Beware of technical issues with labs/quizzes. I got a 0 on a quiz I took because it didn't record my attempt and he basically said "oh well". Issues make labs impossible to complete so I had to guess. He says he'll fix issues but then never gets back to you.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: He's a sweet guy, but the class is extremely boring. I just read the online textbook as he lectures (all he does it read from it anyway). Textbook is mandatory (tests are through it). At least 2 labs (time varies) every unit. Tests aren't hard if you do the self quizzes, but you'll fail if you don't do them. Wish I didn't take the class honestly.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Tests are ridiculously hard and have nothing to do with the study guide he provides. The textbook is tedious because you have to read and take notes on everything and not just the highlighted portions. For tests, ask for practice questions because they are the same ones in the test. That's the only way I passed this class. Do the extra credit.

This class is passable but you have to work extremely hard because the teacher won't put any effort in helping you succeed. When ever we critiqued him or told him how he could do better he ignored us and kept going on with the lecture. He's really lecture heavy. Tests are hard. Extra credit and attendance does count in the end and help your grade.
first two tests were tough, but the last two he gave review questions and pulled the test from them. course material was a little boring.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This professor makes this class ridiculously hard for a gen-ed course. He is teaching it as if we are getting a PHD in the course. I am a straight A student and I will probably end this class with a low B because he is not great at explaining things. And if you email him, he will not answer. He is not accessible outside of class. DON'T TAKE HIM!!!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: He has an accent. Labs are easy 100, you have 5 attempts to get it right. The class average for the tests was usually in the failing zone. Takes attendance through a sign in sheet which goes around the room. The test is in class but online so you MUST have a laptop. Extra credit was easy and interesting, bumped my final grade from a B to an A.

I am a straight A student and found this class so difficult that I withdrew. For a subject that is really fairly simple, he made it so difficult. His tests are incredibly hard. His lectures are also extremely boring. Its far too difficult for a general education class and I wouldnt recommend this class to anyone. Find another professor.

Most assignments were online, and we got multiple attempts at quizzes and labs. The tests were somewhat difficult, but they aren't weighted as heavily as the labs, so the don't really affect your grade that much. You have to sign in to every class - attendance is a grade - and he reads the slideshows verbatim, so that's super boring.

He would often call people out on things they couldn't help, such as disabilities or not understanding. In his 8AM class he said we could eat, but nearly every morning that I had food he would get aggravated and say something like "Do you have enough to share?" He was generally rude and would blame us not understanding on us rather than explaining.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: For my online class, we had 11 labs and 4 tests. You could retake each of the labs 5 times if you didn't do so well the first time and the test were easy if you did the study guide! He also offers hefty extra credit that is worth doing if you choose to.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Not an easy A, but doable. I took his 8 AMs and fell asleep constantly because of his monologue style voice. I'd avoid if at all possible. dont skip class or else you're screwed.

You'll either have to take good notes or read. He drops grades and the labs are pretty easy and he gives you multiple attempts. Quizzes come from the lecture on that day. Generally easy to talk to though he's not too reliable outside of class. Long tests. Hard-ish material. If you care you'll be fine. If you don't you should find someone else.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: Total of 10 labs and 4 tests. The labs were all multiple choice and we used google earth for all of them except for 1 I think. Tests were a little difficult but not too bad. He drops your two lowest lab grades which is pretty great. He said the book was necessary but I didn't buy it.

Not quite sure why most people are giving him bad ratings. The class was not that hard. There's a total of 10 labs which are all multiple choice. He will drop 2 of your lowest lab grades. I scored a B for all the labs. You will be using google earth for the labs. 4 tests which aren't too bad either. Overall I thought it was a pretty easy class.

He is really not that bad. Astonished to see all the bad ratings. If you are completely new to geography and need things thoroughly explained than I would not recommend. I just read the book on my own time, study my notes, do my work and I'm doing well in the class. All depends on you!

Would not take this class. The test are 80 questions and very hard. He is hard to understand and talks very softly. There are labs as well online and they are very unclear and difficult. He means well but wouldn't take this class ever again.

Very hard to understand when he is talking. If you don't study the study guide you will fail. He teaches the course like it a PhD course. It was a general required course. Of a class of 80 students none of us were interested in geography.

Tests and quizzes are incredibly hard. He makes you feel like you're dumb when you ask a question and the fact that you're asking a question is such a hassle. Every lecture is just reading off a PowerPoint.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He loves his field of study, but doesn't relate it well. Reads from Power Points. DO NOT TAKE 8 AM. You will fall asleep during his lecture. Quizzes every week in Lab. Tests are harder than expected. Easy extra credit at the end.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This professor gives extremely difficult tests. He takes this course so seriously when in reality we're all in it because all of the other sciences filled up. Very lecture heavy. He says you can come to him with any questions and he will help, but every time I asked him something he acted like it was such a burden answering my question.

Reads directly from the powerpoint, very long & boring lectures. Each lab day you will have a quiz, labs are not very well explained but if you work together you will get a good grade. Tests are hard!!

At first he seems like an ok professor, but as soon as you ask him why you got a question wrong on a test his demeanor changes and he makes it apparent that you're annoying him. In just asking for a clarification or explanation he makes you feel like you're wasting his time.  he makes you very reluctant to want to ask him anything!

This class was pretty difficult, but you can make a good grade, if you work for it. There is a quiz over the assigned chapter every week, but, as long as you actually read, you're fine. I studied quite a bit for the tests and did well. The quizzes and labs will help your grade.

Incredibly boring class, very dry material and he just reads straight off the power point the whole time. I would never have gone of it weren't for the attendance policy, all the material is online. Labs can be confusing and time consuming. Tests are challenging. The class is taught like it's a higher level science, not gen ed. Avoid if you can.
Great teacher! Love the class, he made it interesting. Easy A

Easy enough. 4 tests, 1 weekly lab (2 lowest dropped), some extra credit (WHICH IS EASY AND BUMPED ME UP A LETTER GRADE, SO YOU SHOULD DO IT). There's your grade. Labs can be time consuming and confusing, but they're easy Bs. Tests can be kinda hard. Just study. A B is easy if you do the work, but you're gonna have to actually try for an A.

Definitely do not take this class with this teacher. He's a nice enough guy, but some people just don't make decent teachers and he is no exception. Attendance is mandatory, so if you do get stuck with him don't listen to him during the lectures and use the class time to outline the textbook. He also doesn't follow syllabus due dates, so good luck.
On-line course. Work flow follows syllabus. Lots of chapters to read from text book. You must keep up. Assignments are due and not accepted late. Something due weekly.

I took this online and found it not very difficult.  It is time consuming, but not hard.  If you wait to the last minute to do labs and study, then you will rate the professor low because of your own laziness like the people below.  Just do your work and an easy B, an A if you actually study

This professor was extremely difficult to understand and he taught this class as if it were an upper level geography class, not just an general education requirement class. He did give extra credit worth 10 points however which helped some people. Overall I would not take this class again. He doesn't bump your grades at all either.

It is what is. Very dry material, especially since this professor just reads off the power point the whole time. Attendance is mandatory (ugh), but I would often do the labs or other work during the lecture. If you study for the tests, do the labs, and do the extra credit, you'll be fine. If you can, however, try to avoid this professor.
just don't take him unless you want to be studying for his class 24/7. Very hard!

I DONT Recommend this class, it should be an easy GEN-EDU science but he takes it way too serious and has an accent that is almost impossible to understand, not to mention how boring and monotone he can be. He is REALLY Smart, However I believe that impacts on how he teaches and thinks were all on his same level. His labs are ridiculous too. NO Bet

He is a very nice guy, but I would not recommend his class. The labs are very vague and contain errors.The tests are the hardest I've taken in college. They require many many hours of studying and cover a large amount of information that can be very confusing and detailed on the tests.
Very sweet but very unorganized. Class is ridiculously difficult, avoid unless you know geography well. Not worth the stress, find another science class!

This is this worst I've ever had!. All my friends said it would be an easy A but not with this professor. Attendance is mandatory but he reads straight from the power points which he puts on line. The labs are awful and the test are way to hard than they should be. Grades are returned very late. Extra credit is offered because its so necessary!

worst class ever. He doesn't make the labs, and whoever does make them is inaccurate on locations and elevations. He doesn't put in much effort, but is nice. He is hard to understand, and the tests are very hard. i recommend NOT taking this class ever. it will cause only stress.
